RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the border patrol agents: Andrew P. Graham and Jay Snodgrass
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the agents: Andrew P. Graham and Jay Snodgrass
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.experienced officers: Andrew P. Graham and Jay Snodgrass
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.a Border Patrol agent: Andrew P. Graham and Jay Snodgrass
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.law enforcement officers: Andrew P. Graham and Jay Snodgrass

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Michael Brett Jacquinot: Defendant convicted for possession with intent to distribute marijuana, who entered a conditional plea of guilty and was sentenced to 46 months' imprisonment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Andrew P. Graham: Border Patrol Agent with three years' experience serving in the Alpine area, provided testimony about Highway 385's reputation as a smuggling route, testified about traffic patterns and his experience, described the truck's appearance, aware of recent narcotics smuggling in the Alpine area destined for Kansas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jay Snodgrass: Border Patrol Agent with eleven years' experience, including a few months in the Alpine area, whose prior observation of the truck was confirmed by Agent Graham
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Andrew P. Graham and Jay Snodgrass: Border Patrol Agents involved in surveillance near the United States/Mexican border, providing reasonable suspicion for a stop based on proximity to the border, with experience contributing to the determination
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot: driver of the truck, defendant in a drug trafficking case, argues against the contribution to reasonable suspicion, exhibited suspicious behavior while driving, sole passenger in the truck
